Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Oberoi_SahlHasheesh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this beautiful hotel in the centre of Paris. It is very well located and close to Champs Elysees. The rooms are nice and clean. The lobby area is trendy and bright. The staff are also very helpful and friendly and speak English and French. The breakfast is just right. Lots of small cafes and restaurants close by at a walking distance. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Why rating of this hotel are so low in tripadvisor ?”
Reviews.Author: tethro
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 6-nights at this hotel in my recent business trip. First, the hotel manager Mr. Abdel is very professional and he understand what to do, I had a couple of problems on booking, both mine and colleague's reservations had complicated situation, however Abdel handled well and replied in emails and phones immediately, I appreciate that. Location is good, easy access to many places on foot or by metro. My room was looked new and clean, in overall services were pretty good to me. Although, room is not big, well you are staying in Paris, what can I say !? My colleague complained that his room is noisy by subway running underneath, but in my room didn't hear much, maybe depends on which room you get. Free WI-FI is good as always, but it was very slow, a little frustrated when you staying in business and needed hi speed internet, but most of hotels should be the same. The only thing unacceptable thing for me, it was on Sunday morning, the lady at breakfast dining room was very rude, I don't know what was wrong with her but she was so mean to every customers, food was good as 22 euros but her attitude, it's not free, we customers paying big bucks to have breakfast at there, why can't you make us happy ?? For overall, I'm happy that I chose this hotel. If you know Paris, you know it's hard to find good place to stay in central Paris, you have to compromise few things anyway. I'm wondering why many other ratings are so low ?

Reviews.Title: “Fine, except for manager's rudeness”
Reviews.Author: PeterCG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, near to St Augustin and walkable to the Champs Elysees. My room was smart and clean: not huge, but reasonable value for central Paris. Like a previous reviewer I found that the shower cubicle leaked water onto the bathroom floor, but the plumbing was otherwise fine. Spoiling what would otherwise have been a positive review was the manager's rudeness: as we were checking out, we were informed that there was a small extra tax, of just under 9 euros, to pay. We gave a 20-euro note and the receptionist went away to get our change, returning with a heap of coins. We said we didn't wish to carry round so many coins and would rather have our change mainly in notes, whereupon the manager came out from his office looking somewhat angry and insisted on having an argument about this. We said we weren't interested in doing so, and would pay the extra by credit card. The manager flounced off after uttering something that (probably fortunately) we couldn't understand. To their credit, his staff seemed embarrassed by his odd behaviour and made polite talk to try to smooth over the problem. A small matter, to be sure, but it tarnished an otherwise positive experience and ensured that we will look for somewhere else next time. The manager could clearly learn a thing or two from his staff, who were most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but have had too many problems”
Reviews.Author: EricPDC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Park Lane quite a few times for work. The good points are that it is in a convenient location, the rooms are comfortable, modern and clean, and the reception staff are friendly. The not so good points are that on two separate occasions I have had problems with the bathroom. Once there was a leak which resulted in the floor being constantly wet and the other was the shower was detached and there was no plug so couldn't have a bath instead. Both these problems the hotel should really have known about before I checked in, especially given the cost of this hotel. Also once I had a room with a TV which wouldn't work. I will be back as my company uses this hotel but I'll be checking the bathroom before I unpack!

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent staff/bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Hassan E
Reviews.Content: Despite a confirmed and prepaid reservation for a two-twin room, the hotel could only offer us a double (not even a queen) bed when we checked in. The desk clerk promised to solve this for us the next day, but his colleagues were unable to and refused to offer any reimbursement. Their service was utterly indifferent and apologetic. Despite the nice rooms, I would not stay here again and I will never prepay a room again either.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Paris dispite SuperShuttle”
Reviews.Author: J_Smythe_Oslo Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great position - only 10 minutes walk from Galeries Lafayette and Opera and only a couple of minutes from Metro stations: Miromesnil & St. Augustin. Hotel was clean, staff were friendly and helpful. We would use it again. The only thing that spoit the weekend was the utterly appaling service from SuperShuttle. Stay clear of them. Not only were they difficult to contact to agree collection from the airport, they cancelled the return journey without notifying us.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. The rooms are a good size and clearly very new. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel also has free wifi. It is about a 5 min walk to the metro and it is on 2 metro lines to it's easy to get around from there. The neighbourhood is very quiet though, with not many restaurants or cafÃ©s. If you're looking for a hotel close to nightlife, I would suggest another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: chicojo1
Reviews.Content: Clean and good location. No ambiance - a box with thin walls - and a front desk and that is it ! Definitely a *** star - not a **** star. You get what you pay for at The Park Lane. No security issues. WIFI is weak and very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mocha2004
Reviews.Content: I am still here but excited on the surprise when I walked into a very clean room that was ready 2 hours ahead of schedule. The front desk is bilingual and helped me plan my vacation - it was great. The rooms are small but I think meet European standards and the walls are a little thin so periodically I heard the other guests but nothing alarming, I am definitely coming back here as it is good value for money. Central location in close proximity to all the sites around the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money! Discraceful service!”
Reviews.Author: grainne77
Reviews.Content: An extremely expensive hotel when you can get so much more for your money in the same area in Paris! I work nearby and due to weather difficulties myself and husband decided to stay in central paris for getting to work in the morning. We would do this on a regular basis but because of extremely bad weather we were unable to use our usual hotel as they were fully booked out. This hotel is by no means a standard 4star and does not compare at all to our usual 4 star just up the road. Rooms are small, staff extremely unfriendly and even agressive! A misunderstanding as in relation to breakfast being included meant that someone from the front desk came down to the breakfast room and insulted my husband in front of everyone while peacefully having his breakfast. It was shameful! The way they treat their own door staff also is discraceful. When I requested an iron and board to the room the 'thing' that they gave me I was afraid to touch - it was stained, dirty and basically the iron did not do its job of ironing. I could go on and on about the breakfast, staff, room etc but all need to say is stay away from here as i've never regretted staying somewhere more for such a ridiculous price!

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: sarahlahoud
Reviews.Content: Actually we stayed in Park Lane Hotel this February for a bussiness trip and to be honest it was a fine stay! Abdel the concierge was very friendly and welcoming, the rooms always clean, even our pyjamas were nicely shaped and placed on our beds! The beds really comfortable and had full wifi access in our rooms, even though some reviews stated otherwise. Very close to boulevard Haussman where u can find galerie lafayette, and printemps! close to the metro station miromesnil, and the champs elysees! thank u Park Lane for ur hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gregconlon
Reviews.Content: as above and ideal if you dont want to spend too much time in the hotel. there is no restaurant there so you will be hungry if you get lazy and decise not to go out! Arguably the cleanest hotel room I have ever been in and possibly the most comfortable bed. Gentleman at reception was very friendly and welcoming. Ideal for a city break with the C. Elysees only a 15 mionute walk. I would give this hotel a very good rating only for the fact that there are very few facilities. However I cant fault the rooms or the service.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced...”
Reviews.Author: TE_GIRL
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for a one night stopover for business. First impressions weren't dazzling. Despite it's 4 star rating and smart website, the hotel reception looked a bit stark and uninviting - a bit like a bank lobby. The staff, although friendly enough didn't appear attentive or remotely that interested. After providing me with my key they just pointed me in the direction of the lift without any explanation about the facilities or services available. However, once I found my room I was actually pleasantly surprised at the size, decor and cleanliness. There were a few glitches here and there such as a broken sink plug, but generally a nice enough room and the bed was comfortable. It's altogether not a very bad stay but the gripe here is that it offers itself up to be a 4 star hotel at pretty high prices but offers nothing near that level in terms of staff service, facilities or attention to detail. Sadly it's far too pricey with nothing to shout about or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: PinaColada02
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at quite a few hotels in Paris for work and this one was surprisingly good. The room size was better than I expected which is still small by American standards but larger (slightly) than the other Paris hotels I've stayed in. It is a very new hotel so everything is designed well and shows nicely. The rooms are tastefully done in a modern style and the furniture was arranged well. I stayed in Room 202 and while small, it didn't feel claustrophobic. The bathroom had pretty tile and was relatively spacious compared to other Paris hotels. The bed was really soft and comfortable - reminded me a lot of the heavenly beds at a Westin. The hotel is on a fairly busy street so don't sleep with the windows open. It wasn't too noisy to sleep as long as the windows were closed. As with other Paris hotels, it's impossible to get an iron in your room. Apparently there is only one in the whole hotel so you have to ask and hope it's not being used by another guest. The only other complaint is that the free wi-fi was real spotty. I was never able to maintain a strong connection and had to use the lobby computer to do any long sustained internet surfing/email checking. The channels on the hotel TV were all in French - I never could find one with English like CNN International but I spent very little time in my room so it was not a big issue. My room came with a free breakfast which was nice -- had all the basics you'd expect with a free hotel breakfast. The location is great -- central and easy to get to other places within the city. The wait staff is what you'd expect in Paris - helpful in a perfunctory way. I stayed there for 3 nights and overall I enjoyed my time there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Very small rooms, average service”
Reviews.Author: sayaz
Reviews.Content: Our superior room was really small, there was barely enough room to fit a cotbed :-( The front desk staff is about friendly but not very helpful. We were not able to have our breakfast at the hotel because they did not have high chairs or baby booster chairs. What really put us down was how they reacted to it. The staff in the breakfast room (which is tiny and underground) did not care we could not have breakfast, essentially questioning why we were traveling with a baby. They thought it was perfectly normal to not accommodate small children and that our requests were unreasonable. When checking-out I expressed my dissatisfaction to the front desk staff, saying I would write a review on Tripadvisor to let travelers know about their service and again they did not care, even encouraging me to do so. It's a pity as it's a brand new hotel but that's Parisians for you (I know I have lived in Paris for 10 years).

Reviews.Title: “Totally Inflexible Even during a natural disaster”
Reviews.Author: gm_cpchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel completly refused to refund or transtfer our booking for Friday the 16th April as we could not make it due to the flight restrictions in place. This hotel has taken the wrong approach and we will certainly never re book at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “ripp off”
Reviews.Author: swissgain
Reviews.Content: stayed from Dec 6-8 at Park Lane Hotel in Paris, originally I did the booking wrong, but figured it out after I have missed the first night, called the hotel which confirmed that the 2nd night is cancelled. But afterwards it turned out that the hotel charged me for the second night as well and they are now blaming hotels.com plus the hotel itself recommended not to use sites like hotels.com.... very cheap excuse! The hotel has very new staff and nobody really seem to understand how it works - stay away. In the elevator I met the owner or manager who was actually laughing about his staff. No wonder the have brandnew people at every place, you probably only work there if you can't find anything else...

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: londonguy2008
Reviews.Content: What a dreadful place. Rooms are absolutley tiny - even by Parisian standards - you couldnt even walk around the bed! Think Japanese capsue-style accomodation and your getting close. No soap in the bathroom (bit of a misnomer - no bath - it could only jsut fit a small shower in!) - in fact no soap in the hotel I assume - as I asked several times during my stay and none could be provided. Breakfast is dreadful - its served in a basement rocked by Metro trains, and on one morning they had run our of everything - including toast and milk! Still charged â‚¬25 for one stale pastry and a undrinkable (black) coffee! Also, the staff are hopeless: due to reports of thefts from the hotel and the safe in my room being the size of a matchbox (and not working!) I asked the staff to put my laptop in the lobby safe when I wnet out. I came back hours later to find the laptop still out on the desk in an unlocked and unsecure office ! the staff said the "didnt have the code to the office safe"! Plenty of other guests/victims complaining about various faults/problems at reception, so even waiting to check took 20 mins. A 4 star rating honestly is a joke - I doubt it deserves 2 star. The Park Lane is exactly the type of place that gives Parisian hotels a bad name. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THIEVES!”
Reviews.Author: simonesilv
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is new and well located, but the manager is incredibly rude! On the day that I was checking out, while I packed my suitcase to go to the airport, I noticed that my lingerie bag full of Victoria Secret's underwear worth over US$400 had disappeared from the room. I was in shock! Would it be possible that a hotel of this calibre had thieves? After all, this is supposed to be a 4 stars hotel, not a bedsit next to La Rue Saint Denis!!! I complained to the manager, Ms. Laura Lamblin, who told me that I had to go to the police station (WHERE???HOW DO I GET THERE???) and file a report. Well...for one I didn't have the time because I had transatlantic flight to catch and also, I do not speak French. The incident was very upsetting, but worst of all was the way that I was treated. Ms. Lamblin was supremely rude (doing a disservice to the reputation of Parisians, such a cliche') and decided that the best way to solve the problem was to issue a 'certificate' stating that my lingerie bag was "accidently' thrown in the rubbish bin by the cleaning staff. And how does that exempts the hotel of any responsibility??????? Also, you had to be a moron not to see that my silk bag was full of barely worn expensive underwear. All I know is that: 1) my belonging were inside the hotel and disappeared; 2) the manager not only did not offer any compensation, but also did NOT apologize. 3) I hope that this message will avoid you going through the same distress that I went through. Ms. Lamblin, what comes around goes around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location, but terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Volsk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a fantastic location and has recently been refurbished, which has the makings of a perfect business hotel. But.... the staff there were absolutely terrible. I needed an iron and ironing board for my business trip - a fairly standard request. I asked for it on arrival at 6:30pm, then followed up at 7:30pm on my way out to dinner. On returning from dinner it was still not in my room. Midnight is too late to order an iron, they said, so they would deliver it in the morning (I stressed the urgency of the exact timing, which they agreed to). It never arrived, and when I followed up with a call 15 minutes after expected arrival time, no one answered. I had to go 2 days on a business trip with no ability to iron my shirt, and no apology for inconvenience. When I checked out there was a â‚¬16 hotel room bar charge that I didn't use. They took it off the bill, but still tried to charge me â‚¬10 more than the room should have cost (which they also took off the bill when I pointed it out). My colleague also had a mini bar bill that he didn't actually use (they took that off too). There was a massive pile of papers from others who were had mini bar fees on their bills that weren't from their usage. I can only assume that the cleaning team have a nice supply of mini alcohol bottles? I followed up with a complaint email to the management, asking for an explanation regarding the iron, but haven't received a reply yet (and don't expect to!). Avoid this place unless they learn to train their staff. If they did, this could be the best business hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: oblikomorale
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, It has been redecorated just recently. The rooms are spacious and got very nice design. The location is good as well, One of the main streets (Malesherbes) is right on the corner. However, the sink pipes were leaking and after 3 days of making notes to the concierge, nothing has been done. All in all a bit too expensive, considering that the breakfast wasn't even included. Some of the rooms have the "look-at-the-wall" view.

Reviews.Title: “New with modern design and great location, definitely a perfect find”
Reviews.Author: RenaeBuckinghamshire
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris and as I'm so fussy when it comes to hotels I was really keen to get it right. Having reviewed so many hotels i finally decided upon the Hotel Park Lane Paris and upon arrival i was very pleased with my choice. The rooms are smaller than most hotel rooms but i'm informed that this is typical for Paris. But overall the rooms are very pleasant and everything is new and fresh feeling. The bar isn't really much of a bar it just looks pretty near reception with cute pink chairs. The reception staff are very helpful and offer a great level of service. The location is perfect and takes just 10mins from Paris Nord by underground train. You can take the RER E direction Saint Lazare, get off the train at Saint Lazare Station and walk down the Rue de la PÃ©piniÃ¨re. You can by a carnet ticket that buys you 10 rides for 11.40 Euro's you can buy this on arrival though the queue for the machine & ticket desk can be very busy. Across the road on the corner from the hotel is a supermarket where you can stock up on water plus any other essentials. Plus, there is a Metro station Miromesnill on the right as you come out of the hotel which is perfect to getting you to all the key places, Champs-ElysÃ©es and the Arc de Triomphe. I can highly recomment visiting the Eiffel Tower at night it was totally stunning. I'm planning on returning to Paris and will definitely be staying at the Hotel Park Lane Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great city”
Reviews.Author: bailestil
Reviews.Content: My first time in Paris and both Paris ang the hotel were lovely.the room was clean and the beds comfortable.the breakfast room I quite liked the decor unlike one of the earlier reviewers.didn't like it.the staff were friendly and helpful.The location of the hotel was veru convenient to two metro stops from where you could access all of the city.I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel The free internet in the lobby was useful to e-mail home etc.I also want to pay tribute to the staff who on saturday 08 August had to deal with a very angry and rude customer who it appeared had just arrived at 9.00a.m.and insisted on his being available immediately. He was shouting and swearing in english although that did not appear to be his first language.the staff were at all times calm and courteous to him which to be honest was more than the gentleman deserved. So well done to the staff on reception and also well done to the person in charge who came out to try and reach a solution .I would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RachelIsrael
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Park Lane when spouse had to attend busines. The room (503) is newly decorated with an efficient air-conditioning, double-glazed without noise from the street. The location is nice, walking distance to the Madleine, and the grand magasins. If your room rate does not include breakfast, you might enjoy eating a croissant outside better.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: hoojhooj
Reviews.Content: I prepaid for 2 nights at 150euro per night for a saturday & sunday. When I prepaid this hotel 2 weeks before my arrival, I actually called in to confirm with the receptionist that I would only stay in the hotel if i can be located on the 5/F where it has a big balcony. I even wrote this remarks during my online reservation at their offical Hotel Park lane website. I was deeply disappointed at the time when i checked in and found out that all rooms on 5/F has been taken and the only room left is 3/F. i checked into the room turning on my laptop but found out that the wifi internet network doesn't work. I went down to the reception and tested the network but still failed. After standing infront of the reception for almost an hour getting no useful help from the receptionist, I requested to check out and ask for a refund. The receptionist called to the manager Laura Lamblin and i managed to speak to her over the phone. she insisted that their network has no problem and as my rate is a prepaid rate, no refund will be given to me even if i checked out now. I offered to stay for 1 night only and check out the next day to find a hotel which has accessible internet but she still insisted that no refund will be made. Without internet, I could not work on my work emails and felt extremely inconvenient to go down to the lobby to use their computer. Secondly, in terms of location, although the hotel is only about 10-15 minutes walk to some major sight seeing/ shopping areas, it is surrounded by BEGGARS. During my stay, there were always 4-5 beggars sleeping on the street very near to the hotel which make me felt not very safe. Thirdly, on the first night, I went down to the reception and asked for shower gel as i could only find shampoo, bath salt & moisturiser in the bathroom. The receptionist (obviously a night shifted receptionist who could hardly speak english) told me that he is all by himself and therefore could not find any showergel for me. I then asked for toothbrush as i was expecting they would have this kind of amenties. Again, he said their hotel does not provide any toothbrush at all. Luckily, there is a supermarket just opposite to the hotel and i managed to buy the amenities myself. Forthly, the room is extremely small. At the moment you walk in, the bed is almost right infront of you. The towel provided is of very poor quality. Apart from the above, the room is quite new and the bed is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, recently opened and all new, nice and modern look. Very good!”
Reviews.Author: dmasata
Reviews.Content: The location in the area of bvd de la Madeleine / bvd Malesherbes is ideal for shopping, Champs-Elysees... you get everywhere very quickly. The hotel has only been opened in Feb/Mar 2009 and thus is brand new. The rooms are small (as always in Paris) but very modern, nice bathrooms, clean and very good value for money. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who looks for a modern, clean room in a very nice location. If you look for a hotel with all amenities (bar, fitness, pool, business center), then this is not the right place as it doesn't feature that.

Reviews.Title: “good position, good price”
Reviews.Author: tecnopicci
Reviews.Content: A romantic holiday in Paris for me and my wife. We choose this hotel because the price was ok, especially thinking about the position of the hotel, which is really in the centre, 15 minutes by walk from Champs Elysee, and about 250 meters from underground station (one in St. Augustin, other station I donâ€™t remember). We paid 150 euro / night. Hotel is totally refurnished, room is not so big and spacious, but comfortable, clean and very warm. We got only room, without breakfast, because we think 45 euro for 2 peopleâ€™s breakfast was a little expensiveâ€¦. anyway crossing the street you can find a lot of cafÃ¨, brasserie, and anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: H0merSimpson
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in early April at the Park Lane in Paris. Recently renovated, really great location and good service. Room size is average for Paris at this level and there were no issues with cleanliness. Service was good and breakfast was very good. The hotel has not star rating yet, and I'd say it is a "just 4 stars". Some negagtive issues: - Breakfast room is a tiny crypt in the second basement, very small and not very confortable, but at least properly decored and serving very good breakfast. - Very small room. More like 3 stars than 4 stars. Very well mantained and OK decor, but small. - Towels. The worst fabric quality they could find and with a disgusting smell (like vinager!). We preferred to buy some cheap towels acorss the road and use them. Overall the hotel was OK and given we paid less than 50% their rack rates including breakfast and internet, it was very good value for money. Would not recommend if you have to pay near rack rates (300 Euros and up!).

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Park Lane Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Rue La Boetie, 75008 Paris, France
